channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tariff troubles: A rubber duck museum is migrating to Canada to stay afloat
item.description: Upset by tariffs and President Trump's insistence on making them the 51st state, Canadians are boycotting the U.S. Without them, the Rubber Duck Museu...

item.title: Slightly unusual 'atmospheric river' event to hit Southeast U.S.
item.description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration says an "atmospheric river" event is set to hit Florida and other parts of the Southeast. The weat...

item.title: Russia's Putin proposes direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on May 15
item.description: Putin proposed restarting direct talks with Ukraine "without preconditions," hours after European leaders urged Moscow to accept an unconditional 30-d...

item.title: Federal employee unions fight for survival as Trump tries to eviscerate them
item.description: In 1978, Congress gave federal workers the right to organize and bargain collectively, finding it in the public interest. Now Trump wants to end those...

item.title: We asked, you answered. Here are your most memorable moments with Mom for Mother's Day
item.description: NPR received nearly 500 submissions from around the country and beyond from people who shared favorite memories of their mothers — whether she's still...

item.title: Surgeon gave girlfriend anesthesia drugs to control her, prosecutors say
item.description: Victim's mother says Dr. James Ryan noticed Sarah Harris years earlier in a toy store where she was dressed as Elsa from "Frozen."

item.title: Here Comes the Sun: Larry Gagosian and more
item.description: Art dealer Larry Gagosian sits down with Anthony Mason to discuss his 18 galleries around the globe and the competitiveness of New York's art world. T...

item.title: Why an oral surgeon became a murder suspect in girlfriend's death
item.description: Sarah Harris' mother believes Dr. James Ryan dominated every aspect of her daughter's life, brought her powerful habit-forming drugs, and is therefore...

item.title: What is habeas corpus and why might Donald Trump want to suspend it?
item.description: It is a safeguard against unlawful imprisonment - but the White House is "actively looking" at pausing it.

item.title: Survivor's testimony key in helping convict ex-boyfriend of murder
item.description: C.C. Opanowski says it's still difficult to process the fact that a person she once loved was convicted of murder. She hopes that others can learn fro...

item.title: What Trump does next on Ukraine is key - and he could go either way
item.description: Neither Putin nor Zelensky want to be seen by Trump as the obstacle to peace, writes Frank Gardner.

item.title: Pope Leo prays at tomb of Francis ahead of first Sunday address
item.description: Pope Leo will be formally inaugurated at a mass next week.

item.title: India-Pakistan ceasefire appears to hold after accusations of violations
item.description: Delhi and Islamabad earlier accused each other of breaches, after four days of cross-border attacks.

item.title: Woman learns man who attacked her killed a young mother years later

item.title: A split jury and a lie sent him to prison. Now he’s working to change Louisiana’s law
Economic jitters and soaring gold prices create a frenzy for US jewelry merchants
Zelensky says Russia considering end to war a 'positive sign'
item.description: The Ukrainian president reiterates calls for a 30-day ceasefire after Vladimir Putin offered "direct talks".

item.title: Turkish Tufts University student back in Boston after release from Louisiana detention center
item.description: A Tufts University student from Turkey has returned to Boston after being released from a Louisiana immigration detention center.
